text: Mattias Falck (né Karlsson) (born 7 September 1991) is a Swedish table tennis player. ==Career== He competed at the 2016 Summer Olympics as part of the Swedish team in the men's team event. Mattias won two medals at the 2016 European Table Tennis Championships. Paired with Matilda Ekholm he won a silver medal in mixed doubles,http://www.expressen.se/sport/svenskt-silver-i- bordtennis-em/ and paired with Kristian Karlsson he won a bronze medal in men's doubles.http://www.svt.se/sport/bordtennis/svensk-em-medalj-sakrad-i- dubbel/ He won the Swedish National team championship with Halmstad BTK 2018 same years as he was a part of the Swedish National team who won a Bronze medal at WTTC 2018 which was played in Halmstad Arena (the same arena where Halmstad BTK won gold a month later). In April 2019, he won a silver medal in the men's singles competition during the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, after losing the final game to Ma Long from China. Falck's highest world rank was 7th, attained in August 2019. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Swedish male table tennis players Category:Olympic table tennis players of Sweden Category:Table tennis players at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:People from Karlskrona Category:European Games competitors for Sweden Category:Table tennis players at the 2019 European Games Category:European Games medalists in table tennis Category:European Games silver medalists for Sweden
title: Mattias Falck
